intro: Silene bersieri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada silene, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the harsh mountain environment. Silene bersieri is often found in alpine meadows and is a symbol of the Sierra Nevada region's unique biodiversity.
